scopes.read_homecoach: Read data coming from Healthy Home Coach
Read data coming from Healthy Home Coach

methods.description: Links a callback url to a user.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Your webhook callback url

parameters.name: appType
parameters.description: Webhooks are only available for Welcome, enter app_camera.

methods.description: The method createnewschedule creates a new schedule stored in the backup list.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The relay id

parameters.name: moduleId
parameters.description: The thermostat id

methods.description:
The method devicelist returns the list of devices owned by the user, and their modules.
A device is identified by its _id (which is its mac address) and each device may have one, several or no modules, also identified by an _id.

parameters.name: appType
parameters.description: Defines which device type will be returned by devicelist. It could be app_thermostat or app_station (by default if not provided)

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Specify a device_id if you want to retrieve only this device informations.

parameters.name: getFavorites
parameters.description: When set to "true", the favorite devices of the user are returned. This flag is available only if the devices requested are Weather Stations.

methods.description: Dissociates a webhook from a user.

parameters.name: appType
parameters.description: For Welcome, use app_camera

methods.description: Returns the snapshot associated to an event.

parameters.name: imageId
parameters.description: id of the image (can be retrieved as 'id' in 'face' in Gethomedata, or as 'id' in 'snapshot' in Getnextevents, Getlasteventof and Geteventsuntil)

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Security key to access snapshots.

methods.description: Returns the snapshot associated to an event.

parameters.name: homeId
parameters.description: ID of the Home you're interested in

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: Your request will retrieve all the events until this one

methods.description: The method gethomecoachsdata Returns data from a user Healthy Home Coach Station (measures and device specific data).

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Id of the device you want to retrieve information of

methods.description: Returns information about users homes and cameras.

parameters.name: homeId
parameters.description: Specify if you're looking for the events of a specific Home.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of events to retrieve. Default is `30`.

methods.description: Returns most recent events.

parameters.name: homeId
parameters.description: ID of the Home you're interested in

parameters.name: personId
parameters.description: Your request will retrieve all events of the given home until the most recent event of the given person

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of events to retrieve. Default is 30.

methods.description: The method getmeasure returns the measurements of a device or a module.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Id of the device whose module's measurements you want to retrieve. This _id can be found in the user's devices field.

parameters.name: moduleId
parameters.description: If you don't specify any module_id you will retrieve the device's measurements. If you specify a module_id you will retrieve the module's measurements.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description:
Defines the time interval between two measurements.
Possible values :
max -> every value stored will be returned
30min -> 1 value every 30 minutes
1hour -> 1 value every hour
3hours -> 1 value every 3 hours
1day -> 1 value per day
1week -> 1 value per week
1month -> 1 value per month

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Measures you are interested in. Data you can request depends on the scale.
**For Weather Station:**
  * max -> Temperature (°C), CO2 (ppm), Humidity (%), Pressure (mbar), Noise (db), Rain (mm), WindStrength (km/h), WindAngle (angles), Guststrength (km/h), GustAngle (angles)
  * 30min, 1hour, 3hours -> Same as above + min_temp, max_temp, min_hum, max_hum, min_pressure, max_pressure, min_noise, max_noise, sum_rain, date_max_gust
  * 1day, 1week, 1month -> Same as above + date_min_temp, date_max_temp, date_min_hum, date_max_hum, date_min_pressure, date_max_pressure, date_min_noise, date_max_noise, date_min_co2, date_max_co2

**For Thermostat:**
  * max -> temperature (°C), sp_temperature (°C), boileron (sec), boileroff (sec)
  * 30min, 1hour, 3hours -> temperature, sp_temperature, min_temp,
max_temp, sum_boiler_on, sum_boiler_off
  * 1day, 1week, 1month -> temperature, min_temp, date_min_temp,
max_temp, sum_boiler_on, sum_boiler_off

parameters.name: dateBegin
parameters.description:
Starting timestamp (utc) of the requested measurements.
Please note measurement retrieving is limited to 1024 measurements.

parameters.name: dateEnd
parameters.description:
Ending timestamp (utc) of the request measurements.
If you want only the last measurement, do not provide date_begin, and set date_end to `last`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of measurements returned (default & max is 1024)

parameters.name: optimize
parameters.description:
Allows you to choose the format of the answer.
If you build a mobile app and bandwith usage is an issue, use `optimize = true`.
Use `optimize = false`, for an easier parse. In this case, values are indexed by sorted timestamp.
Example of un-optimized response :
```json
{"status": "ok", 
  "body": {
    "1347575400": [18.3,39],
    "1347586200": [20.6,48]
  },
"time_exec": 0.012136936187744}
```
If optimize is set true, measurements are returned as an array of series of regularly spaced measurements. Each series is defined by a beginning time beg_time and a step between measurements, step_time:
```json
{"status": "ok",
  "body": [
    {"beg_time": 1347575400,
     "step_time": 10800,
     "value": 
        [[18.3,39],
        [ 20.6,48]]
    }],
"time_exec": 0.014238119125366}
```
Default value is `true`.

parameters.name: realTime
parameters.description:
In scales higher than max, since the data is aggregated, the timestamps returned are by default offset by +(scale/2).
For instance, if you ask for measurements at a daily scale, you will receive data timestamped at 12:00 if real_time is set to `false` (default case), and timestamped at 00:00 if real_time is set to `true`.
NB : The servers always store data with real_time set to `true` and data are offset by this parameter AFTER having being time-filtered, thus you could have data after date_end if real_time is set to `false`.

methods.description: Returns previous events.

parameters.name: homeId
parameters.description: ID of the Home you're interested in

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: Your request will retrieve events occured before this one

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of events to retrieve. Default is 30.

methods.description: Retrieves publicly shared weather data from Outdoor Modules within a predefined area.

parameters.name: latNe
parameters.description: Latitude of the north east corner of the requested area. -85 <= lat_ne <= 85 and lat_ne>lat_sw

parameters.name: lonNe
parameters.description: Longitude of the north east corner of the requested area. -180 <= lon_ne <= 180 and lon_ne>lon_sw

parameters.name: latSw
parameters.description: Latitude of the south west corner of the requested area. -85 <= lat_sw <= 85

parameters.name: lonSw
parameters.description: Longitude of the south west corner of the requested area. -180 <= lon_sw <= 180

parameters.name: requiredData
parameters.description: To filter stations based on relevant measurements you want (e.g. rain will only return stations with rain gauges). Default is no filter. You can find all measurements available on the Thermostat page.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: True to exclude stations with abnormal temperature measures. Default is false.

methods.description: The method getstationsdata Returns data from a user's Weather Stations (measures and device specific data).

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Id of the device you want to retrieve information of

parameters.name: getFavorites
parameters.description: Whether to include the user's favorite Weather Stations in addition to the user's own Weather Stations

methods.description: The method getthermostatsdata returns information about user's thermostats such as their last measurements.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Id of the device you want to retrieve information of

methods.description: The method getthermstate returns the last Thermostat measurements, its current weekly schedule, and, if present, its current manual temperature setpoint.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The relay id

parameters.name: moduleId
parameters.description: The thermostat id

methods.description: The method getuser returns information about a user such as prefered language, prefered units, and list of devices.
The method partnerdevices returns the list of device_id to which your partner application has access to.
Sets a person as 'Away' or the Home as 'Empty'. The event will be added to the user’s timeline.

parameters.name: homeId
parameters.description: ID of the Home you're interested in

parameters.name: personId
parameters.description: If a person_id is specified, that person will be set as 'Away'. If no person_id is specified, the Home will be set as 'Empty'.

methods.description: Sets a person as 'At home'.

parameters.name: homeId
parameters.description: ID of the Home you're interested in

parameters.name: personIds
parameters.description: List of persons IDs

methods.description: The method setthermpoint changes the Thermostat manual temperature setpoint.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The relay id

parameters.name: moduleId
parameters.description: The thermostat id

parameters.name: setpointMode
parameters.description: Chosen setpoint_mode

parameters.name: setpointEndtime
parameters.description: When using the manual or max setpoint_mode, this parameter defines when the setpoint expires.

parameters.name: setpointTemp
parameters.description: When using the manual setpoint_mode, this parameter defines the temperature setpoint (in Celcius) to use.

methods.description: The method switchschedule switches the Thermostat's schedule to another existing schedule.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The relay id

parameters.name: moduleId
parameters.description: The thermostat id

parameters.name: scheduleId
parameters.description: The schedule id. It can be found in the getthermstate response, under the keys `therm_program_backup` and `therm_program`.

methods.description: The method syncschedule changes the Thermostat weekly schedule.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The relay id

parameters.name: moduleId
parameters.description: The thermostat id

apiDescription:
Welcome to the Netatmo swagger on-line documentation !

This site is a complement to the official Netatmo developper documentation using swagger to bring interactivity and easy testing of requests with the "try it" button (authenticate with the authorization code OAuth2 flow by clicking the authenticate button in the methods). You can find the source code for this site can be found in the project netatmo-swagger-ui. You can also use the online swagger declaration file to generate code or static documentation (see netatmo-swagger-api).
